text.__SUMMARY__: Cortinarius gentilis is a deadly fungus of the genus Cortinarius, normally found in North America and Europe.
text.Toxicity: In a study in Finland,  dried and homogenized C. gentilis and C. orenallus mushrooms were orally introduced into a rat. Both species caused renal damage only, the changes of which corresponded to tubulo-interstitial nephritis. C. gentilis has been found to be nephrotoxic to rats.
